urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: If you see water in the road, turn around, find a safe route. Stay alert and up-to-date with our flood warnings at https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15 https://t.co/VvQDxuWMHB

Our #Catterick Flood Storage Reservoir is operating. This reservoir #slows the #flow of water in Brough Beck as it flows towards #Catterick and the #A1 in #NorthYorkshire.
#floodriskmanagement #slowtheflow #TeamEA @EnvAgencyYNE @GavinTabinerEA @johncurtinEA @OliverHarmarEA https://t.co/TLjZvZIbj2

Due to the heavy rain and rising water levels in main rivers this weekend we are using Monksleaze Clyce and the SOWY flood relief channel to divert excess water out of the Parrett. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/CFtT9ef0EC

More stormy and persistent rain is expected this weekend across parts of England.

Stay safe and sign up for flood alerts: https://t.co/P5d6Ax7xwQ

 #Floods #Flooding https://t.co/3YfkRdZjwe

We‚Äôve got teams out monitoring river levels and operating flood risk management assets in the @EnvAgencyYNE region today. Here‚Äôs the current flow rate at our #Ripon Dam asset in #NorthYorkshire. #TeamEA #Incidentresponse #floodriskmanagement #floodaware #plan #prepare #respond https://t.co/EdTePD27ye
It's been a bit damp in Hanwell this weekend. https://t.co/nVLBIrKj3k

A decade of living here and I‚Äôve never seen the canal burst its banks @ILoveHanwell 

Just how much rain did fall ?!

Flood alerts have been issued on lower Ure & Ouse. Riverside floodgates in York being closed & Foss barrier expected to come down shortly. Selby lock gates going in for high tides. 
Floodgates in Boroughbridge closed. 
EA officers patrolling Ripon & Catterick flood storage areas. https://t.co/Ta3lQywK5P
Wettest 24h since 2008 here sweetcorn flooded where @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyNW pumps can‚Äôt keep up for 3 time this year https://t.co/6y4ZX6CItX
The @EnvAgency's report into the environmental performance of water companies is released today. You can read the press release, my foreword and the full report here:  https://t.co/mwr4EUcpjm

tweets.text: @nebyelto That's not supposed to happen, is it? It might be the council you need, but if you call us, we can take some details. Thank you. We're on 0800 807060. Peter

Couple of rainy days & most of the paths are underwater. Wonder if it would help if @Hanson_UK actually maintained the river and cleared the ditches, instead of spending 5 years arguing with the @EnvAgency over who‚Äôs responsible? https://t.co/wXPsZSxm83

@thameswater drains have burst, sewage is mixing with rain water and our gardens are flooded. Sewage in the street and flowing into the Brook. Over an hour on the emergency line and no response yet https://t.co/hDPRZ16l8x

@AnnelieseDodds Hi - Like many in Oxford today we are flooded - but we also have the joy of foul water mixing with rainwater run off, that @thameswater say could not be happening. They've blamed us, @OxfordCity and @EnvAgency for 15 years - ignoring their own engineers.
Pls help https://t.co/qIo8vgJMF3

tweets.text: @newforestwx Thanks for the photo. Are you able to call us, please? We can take some details and tell the local team. 0800 807060. We appreciate the tweet. Peter
